headline.main: From the Department of Oscar Odds and Ends

docs.lead_paragraph: During our conversation with the lovely briefcase-toters from PricewaterhouseCoopers, we learned some fascinating facts about the Oscars. Here they are, courtesy of our favorite accounting firm:

headline.main: Stuffed Envelopes and Other Fun Oscar Facts

docs.snippet: "The Secret of Kells," the film that grabbed a surprise Academy Award nomination for best animated feature earlier this month, won't be a secret to American audiences for much longer....
docs.lead_paragraph: "The Secret of Kells," the film that grabbed a surprise Academy Award nomination for best animated feature earlier this month, won't be a secret to American audiences for much longer. On Thursday, the distributor GKIDS said that it would show the movie at the IFC Center in New York on March 5, two days before it vies with "Coraline," "The Princess and the Frog," "Up" and "Fantastic Mr. Fox" for Oscar honors. Directed by Tomm Moore, "The Secret of Kells" tells the story of a boy living in a Celtic abbey whose adventures with fairies, she-wolves and barbarians lead to the creation of the Book of Kells, the 1,200-year-old illuminated manuscript. Read more on ArtsBeat...
docs.abstract: "The Secret of Kells," the film that grabbed a surprise Academy Award nomination for best animated feature earlier this month, won't be a secret to American audiences for much longer.

headline.main: 'Secret of Kells' Gets U.S. Release Dates

docs.snippet: "The Secret of Kells," the film that grabbed a surprise Academy Award nomination for best animated feature earlier this month, won't be a secret to American audiences for much longer....
docs.lead_paragraph: "The Secret of Kells," the film that grabbed a surprise Academy Award nomination for best animated feature earlier this month, won't be a secret to American audiences for much longer. On Thursday, the distributor GKIDS said that it would show the movie at the IFC Center in New York on March 5, two days before it vies with "Coraline," "The Princess and the Frog," "Up" and "Fantastic Mr. Fox" for Oscar honors. Directed by Tomm Moore, "The Secret of Kells" tells the story of a boy living in a Celtic abbey, whose adventures with fairies, she-wolves and barbarians lead to the creation of the Book of Kells, the 1,200-year-old illuminated manuscript. The film was already planned to be shown in Boston on March 19, but after its Oscar nomination gave it a little extra shine, it will now receive a wider national release in cities including Los Angeles, San Francisco and Chicago starting April 2.
docs.abstract: "The Secret of Kells," the film that grabbed a surprise Academy Award nomination for best animated feature earlier this month, won't be a secret to American audiences for much longer.

headline.main: 'Secret of Kells' Gets U.S. Release Dates

docs.snippet: PricewaterhouseCoopers has handled the balloting for 76 of the Academy's 82 years, and it's a responsibility the firm takes very seriously....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mark it down: Never again will the Bagger make fun of the accountants involved in the Oscar tabulation. Those fine, kind briefcase-toters are often the brunt of nerd jokes or, even worse, simply ignored in favor of, "Hey, is there any more beer left?" They haven't even gotten to appear on the awards show for the last two years, their 15 minutes relegated to a few seconds on the red carpet, where even the briefcases get a star turn. But this year, the year of the 10 best picture nominees and the complicated preferential voting system, the folks at PricewaterhouseCoopers may actually get the attention they so richly deserve. Well, we're writing about them anyway.
docs.abstract: PricewaterhouseCoopers has handled the balloting for 76 of the Academy's 82 years, and it's a responsibility the firm takes very seriously.
